title: Five Reasons Retirees Should Stay in Their 401(k) Plans
sub_head: It’s important to weigh the costs and benefits associated with remaining in a former employer’s retirement plan
body:
David Blanchett (@davidmblanchett) is head of retirement research at PGIM
There is a significant shift today among companies that offer defined-contribution plans, such as 401(k)s and 403(b)s, to make the plans more attractive for people to stay in the plan after they retire.
